Class

Class MainMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • Class.MainMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GenerateId, java.io.Serializable

    public class MainMenu
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, GenerateId
    Represent a Main menu in the restuarant. Main menu can create/update/remove alarcarte or promotion items respectively. Every functions may contain it's condition in order to execute. It implements serializable to allow us to serialize and deserialize to a file
    Since:
    2019/04/01
    Version:
    9.0
    Author:
    Sam Jian Shen
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • GetStringArrayF

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.String>> GetStringArrayF(int mode,
                                                                        int id)
        Converting ArrayList to (List(String))
        Parameters:
        mode - mode 1 and 3 is converting AlaCarteItem arrayList to (List(String)) the different is that 1 of them includes an extra column(Description) mode 2 and 4 is for printing of promotion items , similarly, the only difference is that 1 of them has an extra column(description)
        id - To match the promotional id (Print only the id that matches)
        Returns:
        t2Rows (List(List(String))) used for printing of the formatted table

      • printpromoItem

        public void printpromoItem()
        This print the main menu's promotion item list. Condition: If promotional item is empty, it will display "There is no promotional package" Else, it will proceed to print out the promotional item list

      • getPromoObject

        public Promotion getPromoObject(int id)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        toReturn Promotion depends on promotion's ID (null value if this promotion does not exist)

      • getAlacartObject

        public AlaCarteItem getAlacartObject(int id)
        Get a alacarte item from the main menu's alacarte item list.
        Parameters:
        id - This is the alacarte item ID.
        Returns:
        this alacarte Item depends on alacarte's ID (null value if this promotion does not exist).

      • createMenu

        public void createMenu()
        This is to create/update/remove options in the main menu for alacarte item. All options requires alacarte item's details depend on which options was chosen. Unique IDs was randomly generated with a range between 10000 to 99999. User input "-1" within this method would go back to main menu. Invalid input will be re-prompt. If method process was completed it should print "created/updated/removed" - depend on which option chosen and follow by "successfully" without error. Update and Remove options require alacarte item existence in order for it to work.

      • UpdateMenu

        public void UpdateMenu(int itemIndex,
                       int itemPara,
                       java.lang.Object dataUpdate)
        This is to update the alacarte item in the main menu alarcarte item list. All alacarte item details in alacarte item/s list and promotion's alarcate item/s in promotion/s list are share the same details except their price. This write data into both PromoItem.dat and MenuItems.dat.
        Parameters:
        itemIndex - This is new alacarte item's ID.
        itemPara - This is the chosen option from one of alacarte item's detail (name,price,category,description)
        dataUpdate - This is new alacarte item's category.

      • RemoveMenu

        public void RemoveMenu(int itemIndex)
        This is to remove the alacarte item in the main menu's alarcarte item's list. This also applies promotion's alacarte item, after removed if promotion contain no alacarte item then it will also be removed as well. This write data into both PromoItem.dat and MenuItems.dat.
        Parameters:
        itemIndex - This is the alarcarte item's ID.

      • createPromo

        public void createPromo()
        This is to create/update/remove options in the main menu for promotion. All options requires promotion item's details and alacarte item's details depend on which options was chosen. Unique IDs was randomly generated with a range between 10000 to 99999. User input "-1" within this method would go back to main menu. Invalid input will be re-prompt. If method process was completed it should print "created/updated/removed" - depend on which option chosen and follow by "successfully" without error. Update and Remove options require promotion existence in order for it to work.

      • UpdatePromo

        public void UpdatePromo(int promoIndex,
                        int promoPara,
                        java.lang.Object dataUpdate,
                        java.util.ArrayList<AlaCarteItem> UpdateItems)
        This is to update promotion in the main menu promotion list. Note: Promotion's alarcarte item's price in promotion list was independent from alarcarte item's price in alarcate list. This write data into PromoItem.dat
        Parameters:
        promoIndex - This is the new promotion's ID.
        promoPara - This is the chosen option from one of promotion's detail (name,description,price,alacarte item/s).
        dataUpdate - This is the new promotion's name/description depend on promoPara.
        UpdateItems - This is the new promotion's alacarte item/s depend on promoPara.

      • RemovePromo

        public void RemovePromo(int promoIndex)
        This is to remove promotion in the main menu promotion list. This write data into both PromoItem.dat.
        Parameters:
        promoIndex - This is the promotion's ID.

      • createwritePromoData

        public void createwritePromoData(java.lang.String promoName,
                                 int promoID,
                                 java.lang.String promoDesc,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<AlaCarteItem> selectedMenuItems,
                                 double promoPrice)
        This is to create promotion in the main menu promotion list. This write data into both PromoItem.dat.
        Parameters:
        promoName - This is the promotion's name.
        promoID - This is the promotion's ID.
        promoDesc - This is the promotion's description
        selectedMenuItems - This is the promotion's alacarte item/s
        promoPrice - This is the promotion's price

      • updatePricePromoItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<AlaCarteItem> updatePricePromoItems(java.util.ArrayList<AlaCarteItem> selectedAla,
                                                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> changedPriceItemsID)
        This update the promotion's alacarte item/s' price.
        Parameters:
        selectedAla - This is the selected alacarte item list.
        changedPriceItemsID - This is the selected ID/s in the selected alacarte item list to change the alacarte item/s price respectively.
        Returns:
        this The updated promotion's alacarte item/s' price.

      • checkDuplicateIDs

        public int checkDuplicateIDs(java.lang.String listType,
                             int newRand)
        Description copied from interface: GenerateId
        This function will be used to check for duplicate ID in .dat file
        Specified by:
        checkDuplicateIDs in interface GenerateId
        Parameters:
        listType - "promo" or "ala" to check duplicate for alacarte item or promotion item
        newRand - The ID to check against the database if there exist the same ID
        Returns:
        int value of the duplicate IDs
